, with one of the best preserved Porticos in the region and a lively but relaxed atmosphere.

Cava sits between the Lattari Mountains (which separates Cava from the Amalfi Coast) on the West and the Picentini Mountains on the East, and the built-up valley floor area forms the major centre of population. Various 'Fractions' of the town creep up the slopes of the mountains to the east and the west, and the valley floor falls away on the south towards

to the north. Vesuvius can also be seen to the north in the distance.

Cava is also within easy reach of

value: address=Pineta La Serra, 45, Cava de' Tirreni Salerno

content=Quiet hotel with 23 rooms and located in a beautiful part of town.  It is a few kilometres up into the hills behind Sorento but is well worth the trip.  There is a man who works there that seems to do everything, (check in, cook, clean, wash cars) and he will drive you down to the bus or train station if you want to take a day trip. Private bath, telephone, TV, hairdryer, A/C, independent heating and balconies with sea view. Pompeii is within easy reach. Traditional Kampanien cooking with international style alternatives. Bar-café and a large observation deck.
